titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Photograph of Sehome Hill (Bellingham, Washington) circa 1974-1975
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ruth Steele.

publicationstmt.publisher: Western Washington University, Center for Pacific Northwest Studies

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoded by Rozlind Koester in August 2017.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.abstract: Color aerial photograph of Sehome Hill in Bellingham, Washington, showing the Western Washington University campus, parts of surrounding neighborhoods, Bellingham Bay and the San Juan Islands.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Color aerial photograph of Sehome Hill in Bellingham, Washington, showing the Western Washington University campus, parts of surrounding neighborhoods, Bellingham Bay and the San Juan Islands. Inscription on back reads "Dr. Paul Olscamp, Pres. WWU 1975-1982".

prefercite.p: [Title], Center for Pacific Northwest Studies, Western Libraries Archives & Special Collections, Western Washington University, Bellingham WA 98225-9123.

processinfo.head: About Harmful Language and Content
processinfo.p: To learn more about problematic content in our collections, collection description and teaching tools (including how to provide feedback or request dialogue on this topic), see the following Statement About Potentially Harmful Language and Content

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This resource was transferred to the Center for Pacific Northwest Studies by Nancy Larsen, and donated to Western Washington University by the Chartwell Estates Condominium Association, in memory of Dr. Paul Olscamp.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This resource is open to the public for research.
